result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron E Beasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and childcare.
Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

-No contact with victim Khibresha L. unless approved by agent.
 Court grants third party contact for childcare.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron E Beasley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with Huber privileges for work and childcare.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Khibresha L. unless approved by agent. Court grants third party contact for childcare.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.


Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form,Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Due to court being down, case adjourned to 1/5/2016 at 8:30 in branch 24.

Signature bond reinstated on State's motion. All previous conditions set as to bail to remain in effect.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Any bail on deposit to be forfeited.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 12/14/15 in Branch 40.  Defense informed the Court this matter may still resolve and they will inform the court if it is going to.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defense would like an adjournment as counsel just received new information.  With objection from the state, Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. State to provide additional discovery to defense counsel this afternoon. Case remains set for jury trial on 9/21/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
On motion of the defense, Court modified the no contact order to allow 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Khibresha L.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aaron E Beasley in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Aaron E Beasley in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
